sources.label: DVLA Cardiovascular disorders: assessing fitness to drive (updated 7 Nov 2025)
Assessing fitness to drive — a guide for medical professionals (Nov 2025 PDF)

tloc_redflags.title: Any features suggesting possible cardiac syncope? (classification assist)
tloc_redflags.help: This is guideline-informed screening to avoid calling dangerous cardiac syncope 'simple faint'. If any are present, treat as higher risk pending evaluation.

options.label: Known structural heart disease / cardiomyopathy / severe valve disease
Abnormal ECG (e.g. conduction disease, pre-excitation, long QT, Brugada pattern)

tloc_while_driving.title: Did the episode occur while driving, or is it judged likely to occur while driving?
tloc_while_driving.help: DVLA pathways are stricter when episodes occur at the wheel / likely at the wheel.

tloc_cause_known.title: Is there a clear cause identified and treated / controlled?
tloc_cause_known.help: Examples: AV block paced; SVT ablated; medication-induced orthostatic hypotension adjusted; classic vasovagal with clear triggers and advice.

tloc_event_free.title: Date of most recent episode (DD/MM/YYYY)
tloc_event_free.help: We’ll calculate the event-free duration and apply the DVLA-style minimum restriction in this starter pack.

syncope_at_wheel.headline: Higher-risk TLoC scenario (at the wheel / likely at the wheel)

group1.restriction: Must not drive. Use DVLA cardiovascular TLoC/syncope standards for the specific diagnosis; higher-risk pathways commonly require months off-road and specialist confirmation before return.
group1.notify: May need to notify DVLA depending on diagnosis and recurrence risk.

group2.restriction: Must not drive and usually must notify DVLA (Group 2 thresholds are stricter).
group2.notify: Must notify DVLA if criteria met.

group1.restriction: Must not drive until the cause is identified and recurrence risk is acceptably low under DVLA standards.
group1.notify: Depends on the final diagnosis; check DVLA notifiability for the identified condition.

group2.restriction: Must not drive; Group 2 usually requires DVLA notification and stricter control.
group2.notify: Often must notify DVLA (confirm in DVLA cardiovascular guidance).

syncope_treated_gate.headline: Cause identified and treated/controlled — apply event-free gate (starter logic)
syncope_treated_gate.notes: This starter pack uses an event-free threshold as a conservative gate. Replace/extend with the exact DVLA tables for each syncope subtype in your next iteration.

restrictionLogic.then: If event-free ≥ 3 months and condition is controlled, may be eligible to drive (subject to DVLA subtype rules).
restrictionLogic.else: Must not drive until event-free for at least 3 months and stability confirmed.

group1.notify: Depends on diagnosis; many Group 1 cardiac conditions do not require notification unless DVLA specifies.

group2.restriction: Group 2 standards are stricter — confirm against the DVLA cardiovascular chapter for the exact diagnosis.
group2.notify: Group 2 cardiac conditions commonly require DVLA notification.
